comments:
Sometimes when I start Eclipse, the following message box appears:

"Unable to read workbench.  State workbench UI layout will be reset."

This has happened to me several times.

The log file contains the following info:

Is there any workaround for this problem?
It is a little annoying.

The problem looks to be caused by the VSS plugin which is using internal (i.e. 
non-API) code in the Team plugin. You may want to contact them to indicate 
that they are causing you a problem.

Does this error cause the failure to load all your workspace preferences? If 
so, this is a UI problem as such a failure in a plugin should not have such a 
devistating effect on your workspace preferences. Reassigning to UI to assess 
this.

If needed, I have a copy of the failing workspace configuration.
By selectively comparing and copying the files between the original bad
configuration and the reset one, I've been able to restore my workspace
configuration.
Renaming the problem report more appropriately and reassigning.

Just to be clear, are you losing your preference settings (i.e. settings in 
Window > Preferences) or just the workbench layout.  The former is core-level 
state, the latter is UI-level state.  I'm assuming the latter.
Error handling in the Workbench could be improved here.
PluginAction.refreshEnablement should protect itself better.

Sorry for having been a little ambigous.

I'm losing the layout of the workspace: 

- opened documents,
- opened perspectives
- window position and layout
I will look into this for 3.0.

Should add protection (e.g. use SafeRunnable) when calling client code, e.g. 
in PluginAction.refreshEnablement.
A test for this case would be good.

After R3.0 we should really visit all places where we handle (or don't handle) 
errors like this to find a more robust solution
We still haven't done this audit.
